name: James Njoroge
summary: I am an ambitious, diligent, and analytical student leader with a portfolio in software development, data analytics, and research, exemplified by outstanding academic performance and co-founding a student-run tech startup at Colgate University.

description.1: Built and migrated the MDLZ Incentive Program tracking tool from Excel to a combination of Excel, Essbase, and PowerBI, enhancing data visualization and reporting capabilities.
description.2: Automated global FP&A teamâ€™s monthly financial data ETL processes using Python and Excel, reducing data processing time by 75% and saving the team 2 days of work per month.
description.3: Optimized financial allocations with VBA scripts, reducing a 20-hour process to 1 hour.
description.4: Collaborated closely with the CFO (Luca Zaramella) and key global FP&A stakeholders to ensure new tools met executive requirements, leading to improved user adoption and satisfaction.
description.5: Presented final products and key improvements to MDLZ executive leadership, including the global CFO and treasurer, influencing strategic decision on future financial technology implementations.

description.1: Conduct comprehensive research on emerging GenAI tools, technologies, and trends in academic environments
description.2: Foster and maintain robust, trust-based relationships with professors and students, providing essential academic support and reinforcement to enhance learning experiences.

description.1: Assist students with Python and Java programming assignments, offering guidance and debugging support to strengthen their comprehension of key computer science concepts in Algorithms and Data Structures.
description.2: Foster and maintain robust, trust-based relationships with professors and students, providing essential academic support and reinforcement to enhance learning experiences.

description.1: Designed intuitive user interfaces in R Shiny, enhancing access to complex R-based analyses for users with varying levels of programming expertise, notably enhancing data science accessibility at Colgate University.
description.2: Developed and maintained R Shiny applications for advanced statistical analysis, focusing on geospatial data, social networks, and textual corpora, enhancing research capabilities.
description.3: Collaborated with interdisciplinary research teams, leveraging R Shiny applications to test hypotheses and derive insights from complex data sets, contributing to significant academic advancements.

description.1: Evaluated research and survey-taking methods, and recommended bias-reduction techniques.
description.2: Collaborated with professor to acquire and clean collected survey data using Microsoft Excel.
description.3: Examined research data for trends and anomalies in collaboration with a colleague, thus reducing the margin of error produced by the data.

description.1: Work in a customer-facing role on the phone and in-person.
description.2: Assist the campus community in the usage of technology on campus, including multi-factor authentication, Office 365 Apps, Adobe Software, and Google software.
description.3: Write detailed trouble tickets for users who have issues that need to be escalated to other departments.
description.4: Use Salesforce software to provide support and solutions to affected students, faculty, and staff in various departments.
description.5: Collaborate with a diverse team in a fast-paced atmosphere.

description.1: Worked within the sales team, selling our services and calling potential leads for attendance at the Marketer's Night in Nairobi and Marketer's Quiznite all over Kenya.
description.2: Used Excel and mail analytics to manage and execute the distribution of the Marketing Africa magazine all over Kenya.
description.3: Amalgamated the client database from various social media platforms using Microsoft Excel so as to broaden the reach of the company.
description.4: Collaborated with colleagues to ensure full customer satisfaction in the advertisement sector of the company.

description.1: Led 33 resident students, ensuring a safe, academically-focused environment; organized monthly rapport-building activities.
description.2: Acted as key liaison between students, residential advisors, and school administration, enhancing community communication.
description.3: Resolved student welfare issues with strong leadership, communication skills, and trust-building, fostering a supportive residential community.
